column1: Gus-Khrustalny District (Russian: Гусь-Хруста́льный райо́н) is an administrative and municipal district (raion)
column2: one of the sixteen in Vladimir Oblast
column3: Russia. It is located in the south of the oblast. The area of the district is 4
column5: 690 sq mi). Its administrative center is the town of Gus-Khrustalny (which is not administratively a part of the district). Population: 44

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Gus-Khrustalny District is one of the sixteen in the oblast. The town of Gus-Khrustalny serves as its administrative center
column3: despite being incorporated separately as an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts.As a municipal division
column4: the district is incorporated as Gus-Khrustalny Municipal District. The Town of Gus-Khrustalny is incorporated separately from the district as Gus-Khrustalny Urban Okrug.

column1: The Gusevskoye peat narrow gauge railway for hauling peat operates in the district.
